Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

Tilt by Mary Hoffman

Written by Kate Ashton · Published May 25, 2017

Newmarket Library manager Kate found Tilt "an enjoyable and quick read."

Perfect by Cecelia Ahern

Written by Emma Maguire · Published May 23, 2017

Emma loved, loved, loved Perfect.

The Ravenmaster's Boy by Mary Hoffman

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 16, 2017

The Ravenmaster's Boy puts an enthralling and immersive new spin on the well-known story of Anne Boleyn.

Wave by Paul Dowswell

Written by Kate Ashton · Published May 11, 2017

Newmarket Library manager Kate found Wave "gripping, devastating, compelling and tragic."

Double Digit by Annabel Monaghan

Written by Emma Maguire · Published May 2, 2017

Emma found Double Digit "a worthy sequel" to A Girl Named Digit.

New Young Adult books for May 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Apr 28, 2017

New titles from Rae Earl, Tanya Landman, Patrick Ness and more.

Wing Jones by Katherine Webber

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Apr 27, 2017

Emma loved Wing Jones and is excited to read Katherine Webber's future work

Charisma by Jeanne Ryan

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Apr 25, 2017

Emma found Charisma intriguing and enjoyable.

Island by Nicky Singer

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Apr 20, 2017

Kate found Island a category-defying tale, well worth a read.

The Liar's Handbook by Keren David

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Apr 18, 2017

In The Liar's Handbook, a funny, engaging and determined character with a penchant for storytelling investigates his mum's new boyfriend's lies.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
